2026-01-02.description: Turning point for Gold and Oil. Oil has a very strong weekly cycle alignment here. Gold opens the month with its first turning point.

2026-01-03.description: First Bitcoin turning point. Also near the S&P 500 Jan 5 date - aligns with a weekly cycle.

2026-01-05.description: S&P 500 first turning point. EUR/USD statistical 78% down probability. Strong cluster day.

2026-01-07.description: EUR/USD turning point (range Jan 7-8). Oil statistical 71% down probability.

2026-01-08.description: Gold second turning point. EUR/USD range continues. Gold 83% seasonal up stat from this date through month-end.

2026-01-16.description: MAJOR CONVERGENCE DATE - All five assets have turning points or significant levels on this date. S&P third turning point. Bitcoin second turning point. EUR/USD second turning point with 80% down statistic. Gold third turning point with weekly cycle alignment. Oil second turning point. This is the most significant single date in January 2026.

2026-01-22.description: Bitcoin third turning point. Oil third turning point with weekly cycle alignment.

2026-01-23.description: S&P 500 statistical 68% up probability. Gold fourth turning point with 68% up statistic. Oil statistical 68% up probability. A bullish cluster date.

2026-01-27.description: S&P 500 statistical 67% down probability. Bitcoin fourth turning point (range 27-28). EUR/USD fourth turning point (range 27-28). Oil fourth turning point with 71% down statistic. A bearish cluster date.

2026-01-28.description: S&P 500 fourth turning point. Aligns with the second weekly cycle ending around Jan 30.

key_convergence_dates.description: The most critical date of January 2026. All five assets (S&P 500, Bitcoin, EUR/USD, Gold, Oil) have turning point dates or strong statistical signals on or around January 16. EUR/USD has an 80% downside probability. Weekly cycles align for Gold and Bitcoin. This date should be watched closely for potential broad market directional shifts.

key_convergence_dates.significance: HIGH - 4 assets converge with bearish bias
key_convergence_dates.description: Four assets (S&P 500, Bitcoin, EUR/USD, Oil) show turning points or bearish statistics. S&P has 67% down, Oil has 71% down. Combined with the S&P 500 turning point on Jan 28 and weekly cycle ending Jan 30, the Jan 27-30 window represents a significant risk window.
S&P 500 first turning point date combined with EUR/USD 78% down statistic. The early-January window (Jan 2-8) sees activity across Gold, Oil, S&P, EUR/USD and Bitcoin.
S&P 500 (68% up), Gold (68% up), and Oil (68% up) all show bullish statistical signals, creating a potential risk-on day.

themes.description: S&P 500 has rallied for 8 consecutive months. Gold hit all-time highs. Both show technical divergences suggesting the uptrend, while still intact, is mature and vulnerable to correction.

According to Gann methodology, January often sets the tone for the entire year. A low in January frequently holds for months, while a high followed by a decline can mark the year's peak. Potential geopolitical triggers in Europe, UK, or Israel could serve as catalysts.
January is the most negative month of the year for EUR/USD. Combined with 78-80% downside statistics, this theme of dollar strength could have ripple effects across Gold and commodities.

Bitcoin is in a tightening consolidation after November's sharp rally and December's correction. The 35-month cycle pattern suggests potential for a major directional resolution. The $95,000 breakout vs $84,400 breakdown levels define the binary outcome.

Oil remains in a structural downtrend with declining moving averages acting as resistance caps. Two out of three cyclical patterns point lower. Support at $55 area is under threat with potential for a move to $51 or even $43.

The report repeatedly warns that the biggest danger arrives when markets appear calm. The S&P's smooth 8-month rally, low volatility, and muted corrections create a false sense of security. The Fear & Greed Index recovery to 46 from 24 (November) reflects gradually rebuilding complacency.

risk_rules: Time is more important than price, but price must confirm the turn - wait for price confirmation at turning point dates before acting
Turning point dates are not prophecies - they are indicators of potential change windows with high historical probability
A continuation date (cycle continues) means the trend is expected to persist until the next turning point; it does not mean the price will reverse
Double dates (two turning points close together, like Jan 2-3 for S&P 500 or Jan 27-28) suggest the first date often creates a correction, and the second restores the original trend direction
When working against the general trend direction, the statistical probability is weaker and trades should only be taken after clear confirmation signals
Leverage feels like genius when the market climbs but becomes cruel the moment the market corrects - manage position sizing accordingly
Work with a clear head, not high pulse - this is the key trading principle
The more assets you trade from this report, the more chances you have to finish the month profitably - diversification across all five assets improves odds
January's year-defining nature means building awareness rather than aggression - set alerts, plan scenarios, but wait for price to confirm
All content is for educational purposes only and does not constitute investment advice

seasonal_summary.sp500: Bullish - January is a positive month for the index
seasonal_summary.bitcoin: Bullish - 60% of years positive, 87% chance of higher close Jan 6 vs Jan 1
seasonal_summary.eurusd: Bearish - The most negative month of the year for the Euro
seasonal_summary.gold: Bullish - 83% chance of higher prices from Jan 8 through month-end over 30 years
seasonal_summary.oil: Slightly bullish seasonally, but 2 of 3 cyclical patterns point down - mixed overall
